moves.1. e4 e5: This is rather a risky defence, putting the horse on c6 wpould not leave an opening.
moves.2. Qh5: sp tries to intimidate, but getting the queen out so early is not wise...
moves.2... Nf6: awwwww, attacking the queen is a good idea, but you should have defended the pawn, he was clearly going after it
moves.3... Be7: good, developing and defending at the same time
moves.4. g4: very agressive and intimidating, I would get rid of that queen first
moves.4... Nxg4: if oyu move the horse away FROM somewhere, look at the pieces you leave undefended!
moves.8. f4: you should be able to work with this, the king is exposed
moves.8... Nd4: OH NO!!!  Always put the king in check if you have a good opportunity for an attack!!!!!
moves.9. c3 Ne6: What are you doing, useless moves
moves.10. f5: you can still put the king in check
moves.11. Qf3: I you don't counterattack, they will come to get you
moves.11... Be5 12. d4 Bd7 13. dxe5 dxe5: this is just getting yourself into trouble! Always look how you can hurt the king, it doesn't matter if the other one threatens to take a piece of yours. If you put him in check, he will have to respond to YOU.
moves.14. Bxf4 f6 15. Qh5+: oF COURSE, He sees the holes in YOUR defence
